page.title: 01Glenrothes and Markinch
page.content: The area we studied was an interesting mixture of old and new and town and country.The eastern section of the area is devoted almost exclusively to farming.This area of Fife is one of the richest pieces of farmland in Scotland and the local farmers take good advantage of the fertile soil and the low even contoured landscape. The western half of the area contains a pleasing mixture.In the north lies the town of Markinch with most of the qualities and features we assosciate with a traditional Scottish small town.In the south we have the eastern outskirts of Glenrothes Newtown with its tightly planned housing schemes and the peripheral industrial estate which is such a feature of the planned town.In the extreme south is the village of Coaltown of Balgonie.
